categories.name: Chronos
categories.description: Time-keeping and time-announcing automata. These robots exist to mark, measure, or signal the passage of time through movement, sound, or visual indication.

categories.name: Muse
categories.description: Musical and sound-producing automata. These robots sing, whistle, blow trumpets, beat drums, play flutes, or hiss ‚Äî their primary expressive channel is auditory.

categories.name: Bacchus
categories.description: Wine-serving, drink-dispensing, and convivial automata. These robots pour, serve, select drinkers, or simulate the social rituals of drinking and feasting.

categories.name: Terpsichore
categories.description: Dancing, rotating, and processional automata. These robots move through space ‚Äî circling, spinning, processing, rowing, or walking ‚Äî with their locomotion as the primary spectacle.

categories.name: Prometheus
categories.description: Fire-driven and heat-activated automata. These robots are powered by or respond to fire, steam, or combustion ‚Äî the element of fire is essential to their operation or narrative.

categories.name: Nereid
categories.description: Water-pouring, washing, and hydraulic-service automata. These robots dispense water for ablution, bathing, or purification ‚Äî they serve the body's cleansing needs.

categories.name: Sphinx
categories.description: Deceptive, illusory, and trick-performing automata. These robots exist to fool, deceive, or astonish ‚Äî through impossible survival, fake identities, magic tricks, or paradoxical behaviors.

categories.name: Hierophant
categories.description: Sacred, ritual, and temple automata. These robots serve religious or ceremonial functions ‚Äî performing libations, activating at altars, processing through sacred spaces, or mediating divine presence.

categories.name: Fauna
categories.description: Animal-form automata. These robots take the shape of birds, serpents, peacocks, elephants, dolphins, cows, or other creatures ‚Äî their animal identity is central to their design and meaning.

categories.name: Thoth
categories.description: Measuring, indicating, and scribing automata. These robots point to scales, write on surfaces, display numbers, or track quantities ‚Äî they are instruments of knowledge and record.

categories.name: Persona
categories.description: Human-mimicking and emotionally simulating automata. These robots imitate distinctly human behaviors ‚Äî drinking, nodding, flirting, weeping, gesturing, or appearing as specific individuals. Their power lies in the uncanny simulation of personhood.

categories.name: Dramaturge
categories.description: Narrative and theatrical automata. These robots enact stories, change scenes, perform multi-act sequences, or stage dramatic tableaux ‚Äî they are storytelling machines with beginning, middle, and end.

categories.name: Zephyr
categories.description: Wind-sensing and air-driven automata. These robots respond to or indicate atmospheric conditions ‚Äî weather vanes, pneumatic devices where compressed air is the primary motive force.

categories.name: Cascade
categories.description: Chain-reaction and multi-trigger automata. These robots feature elaborate sequential mechanisms where one action triggers the next in a visible domino-like spectacle ‚Äî the complexity of the causal chain is itself the marvel.

books.title: The Book of Knowledge of Ingenious Mechanical Devices

books.title: De Architectura
books.author: Vitruvius
books.overview: A ten-book Roman treatise that unifies architecture, engineering, materials, hydraulics, machines, and civic design into one system of practice.

books.title: Hero of Alexandria - Automata
books.author: Hero of Alexandria
books.overview: A technical guide to programmable theatrical and mobile automata that sequence motion, sound, and effects through cords, weights, and timing.

books.title: Hero of Alexandria - Pneumatics
books.author: Hero of Alexandria
books.overview: A compendium of pneumatic and hydraulic devices showing how air, water, and heat power temple automata, trick vessels, and early steam mechanisms.

books.title: Liezi
books.author: Liezi
books.overview: A Taoist classic of stories and paradoxes exploring spontaneity, perception, fate, and the limits of rational knowledge.
